q: Which feature of HCP Terraform allows multiple team members to work on the same infrastructure code without state conflicts?
explain: Remote state locking ensures that only one run can modify the state at a time, preventing conflicts between team members.

q: What is the primary purpose of Sentinel in HCP Terraform?
explain: Sentinel is a policy-as-code framework that enforces governance rules during Terraform runs.

q: Which permission level in HCP Terraform allows a user to manage workspaces but not organization settings?
explain: Workspace admins can manage specific workspaces but cannot change organization-wide settings.

q: Which of the following can be enforced using Sentinel policies in HCP Terraform?
explain: Sentinel can enforce technical and cost policies, but code review enforcement is typically handled by the VCS system, not Sentinel.

q: What is the benefit of using HCP Terraform's team-based access control?
choices: Different teams can have tailored permissions for workspaces
All users automatically get full access
It eliminates the need for API tokens
explain: Team-based access control allows fine-grained permission management across workspaces for collaboration and security.

q: Which workflow integration allows teams to trigger Terraform runs automatically after a pull request is merged?
explain: VCS-driven runs allow Terraform to execute automatically when changes are merged in the connected repository.

q: How can HCP Terraform ensure that only approved infrastructure changes are deployed?
choices: By enabling policy checks with Sentinel before apply
By allowing any user to apply changes
explain: Sentinel policies can block applies unless they meet defined compliance and security standards.

q: What does 'run tasks' in HCP Terraform allow you to do?
choices: Integrate external services into the Terraform run lifecycle
explain: Run tasks integrate external tools (e.g., security scanners) into specific phases of the run lifecycle.

q: Which HCP Terraform feature helps track all past changes and applies for audit purposes?
explain: Run history logs all past plans and applies, providing audit trails for compliance.

q: What is the purpose of 'policy sets' in HCP Terraform?
choices: Group multiple Sentinel policies for application to workspaces
explain: Policy sets allow grouping and assigning multiple Sentinel policies to one or more workspaces.

q: How can an organization prevent applies that exceed a defined cost threshold?
choices: By using a Sentinel policy integrated with cost estimation
By disabling applies in workspace settings
explain: Sentinel can integrate with cost estimation to block applies exceeding a set budget.

q: Which HCP Terraform feature allows assigning policies to all workspaces in an organization?
explain: Global policy sets can be assigned to all workspaces across the organization for uniform governance.

q: In HCP Terraform, what does 'read' permission allow a user to do?
choices: View runs and state but not modify
explain: Read permission allows viewing workspace details without making changes.

q: Which tool in HCP Terraform enforces compliance before infrastructure changes are applied?
explain: Sentinel enforces compliance rules before allowing applies.

q: Which of the following are benefits of using teams in HCP Terraform?
choices: Reduced need for individual role changes
explain: Teams allow grouping users for easier permission management and onboarding, reducing repetitive role changes.

q: How can HCP Terraform integrate with security scanning tools during runs?
explain: Run tasks allow integration of security scanning tools into the run lifecycle.

q: What is the function of 'Sentinel enforcement levels'?
choices: Define whether policy failures block runs or just warn
explain: Enforcement levels in Sentinel determine whether policy violations block applies or only generate warnings.

q: Which of the following can be tracked in HCP Terraform's audit log?
explain: Audit logs include user logins, run details, and policy changes, but not module downloads.

q: How can an organization ensure that all workspaces have cost estimation enabled?
choices: By enforcing a global policy set with Sentinel
By enabling it in each workspace manually
explain: A global Sentinel policy set can enforce cost estimation across all workspaces automatically.

q: Which of the following statements about HCP Terraform's governance features is correct?
choices: Policies can be applied before plan, after plan, or before apply
Policies can only be applied before plan
Policies run only on state changes
explain: Sentinel policies can be configured to run at multiple points in the run lifecycle for governance enforcement.

q: What does the 'manage' permission in HCP Terraform allow a team to do?
explain: Manage permission allows creating, updating, and deleting workspaces but not necessarily editing policies unless granted separately.

q: Which HCP Terraform feature can integrate with third-party approval workflows before apply?
explain: Run tasks can integrate with external approval workflows before allowing an apply to proceed.

q: How can HCP Terraform enforce that all resources are tagged with 'Environment'?
choices: By writing a Sentinel policy that validates tags
By adding it to the CLI config
explain: A Sentinel policy can ensure all resources have the required tag before allowing apply.

q: What does the 'plan-only' permission allow a team to do in HCP Terraform?
choices: Run terraform plan but not apply
explain: Plan-only permission allows generating and viewing plans without applying changes.

q: Why would an organization use HCP Terraform's 'workspace locking' feature?
choices: To prevent any changes while an investigation or migration is in progress
To automatically delete old state files
explain: Workspace locking prevents any runs from executing, useful during audits, migrations, or incident investigations.
